page.title: 08EDUCATION IN NENTHEAD
page.content: The London Lead Company provided the first school for 350 pupils and staffed it <that school is now the village hall>. The present school was built in 1899. It is now a Primary School with 54 pupils <age 4-11 years>.There are 2 full-time teachers <including head> and 1 part-time <0.6>.Non-teaching staff are a caretaker,cook,kitchen assistant,midday superviser and a sec- retary <all part-time>. Secondary Education is provided by Samuel King's School in Alston where 33 pupils from Nenthead attended this year.There are no Nenthead pupils in the present sixth form <consisting of only 8 pupils>.As parents can choose the secondary school to which they send their children a few have sent theirs to Queen Elizabeth High School in Hexham.Further Ed. is in Carlisle.
